storyTitle: As Manager, I want to generate schedule reports to monitor team shift adherence

testCases.title: Validate successful schedule report generation with valid filters
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Scheduling database contains test data with employee shifts for the selected date range
Schedule reporting module is accessible and operational
At least one employee, team, and department exists in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule reporting module from the main dashboard or menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule report UI is displayed with date range selector, filter options (employee, team, department), and generate report button visible

steps.action: Select a valid date range (e.g., current week) using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date range is populated in the date fields without validation errors

steps.action: Select specific filters: choose an employee from the employee dropdown, select a team from the team dropdown, and select a department from the department dropdown
steps.expectedResult: All selected filters are displayed in the filter section without errors, and filter values are properly highlighted or shown as selected

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button to request report generation
steps.expectedResult: System displays a loading indicator and processes the request within 10 seconds

steps.action: Review the generated schedule report displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Schedule report is generated and displayed with correct data including: employee names, shift times, dates within selected range, team assignments, department information, and all data matches the applied filters. Report shows accurate shift details for the selected criteria

postconditions: Schedule report is displayed on screen with filtered data
Report data matches the selected filters and date range
System logs the report generation activity
User remains on the schedule reporting page

testCases.title: Verify export functionality for schedule reports
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Schedule reporting module is accessible
Test data exists in the scheduling database
Browser allows file downloads
User has necessary permissions to export reports

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule reporting module
steps.expectedResult: Schedule report UI is displayed with all filter options and export buttons visible

steps.action: Select a valid date range and apply filters (employee, team, or department)
steps.expectedResult: Filters are accepted and displayed without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button to generate the schedule report
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated and displayed on screen with filtered data matching the selected criteria, including all shift details, employee names, and schedule information

steps.action: Click the 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is downloaded to the default download location with filename format 'ScheduleReport_[DateRange].pdf'. File opens successfully and displays correct formatting including headers, columns, shift data, and applied filters. All data from the screen report is present in the PDF

steps.action: Return to the displayed report and click the 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is downloaded to the default download location with filename format 'ScheduleReport_[DateRange].xlsx'. File opens successfully in Excel or compatible application. All data is accurate and matches the screen report including employee names, shift times, dates, teams, and departments. Data is properly formatted in columns with headers

postconditions: PDF file is saved in the download folder with correct data
Excel file is saved in the download folder with accurate data
Both exported files contain the same data as displayed in the screen report
User remains on the schedule reporting page
Export activity is logged in the system

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users cannot access schedule reports
preconditions: Test user account exists with non-manager role (e.g., Employee, Viewer, or Guest role)
Schedule reporting module exists and is protected by role-based access control
API endpoint /api/reports/schedules is secured with authentication and authorization
User is not logged in or logged in with non-manager credentials

steps.action: Login to the application using non-manager user credentials (e.g., Employee role)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and is redirected to the appropriate dashboard for their role

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the schedule reporting module by clicking on the menu or entering the URL directly
steps.expectedResult: Access to schedule reporting module is denied. User sees an error message such as 'Access Denied' or 'You do not have permission to view this page'. User is either redirected to their home page or shown an authorization error page. Schedule reporting module is not visible in the navigation menu

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and attempt to access the API endpoint directly by sending a GET request to /api/reports/schedules with authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden response with error message indicating insufficient permissions. No schedule data is returned in the response body

steps.action: Attempt to access the API endpoint without authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 401 Unauthorized response indicating authentication is required

postconditions: Non-manager user remains unable to access schedule reports
No schedule data is exposed to unauthorized user
Security logs record the unauthorized access attempts
User session remains active but restricted to authorized features only

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to filter schedule reports by department to analyze scheduling patterns

testCases.title: Validate department filter in schedule reports
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Schedule reporting module is accessible and operational
Multiple departments exist in the system with associated employee schedules
Test data includes employees assigned to different departments with scheduled shifts
At least one department has scheduled shifts within the test date range

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule reporting module from the main dashboard or menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule report UI is displayed with date range selector and all filter options including the department filter dropdown visible and enabled

steps.action: Select a valid date range (e.g., current month) using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date range is populated in the date fields without validation errors

steps.action: Click on the department filter dropdown and select a specific department (e.g., 'Sales Department')
steps.expectedResult: Selected department is displayed in the filter section and highlighted as active. No validation errors are shown

steps.action: Optionally select additional filters such as team or employee if needed for the test scenario
steps.expectedResult: All selected filters are accepted and displayed without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button to generate the schedule report
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request within 10 seconds and displays a loading indicator during processing

steps.action: Review the generated schedule report displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Report displays data only for the selected department. All employees shown in the report belong to the selected department. No employees from other departments are included. Report includes accurate shift details, dates, times, and employee information. Department name is clearly indicated in the report header or filter summary

steps.action: Verify each employee record in the report to confirm department association
steps.expectedResult: All employee records in the report are confirmed to belong to the selected department only

postconditions: Schedule report displays only data for the selected department
No data from other departments is visible in the report
Report generation is completed within the 10-second SLA
System logs the filtered report generation activity
User remains on the schedule reporting page with the report displayed

testCases.title: Verify export of department filtered schedule reports
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Schedule reporting module is accessible
Multiple departments exist with scheduled shifts in the system
Test data includes employees from different departments
Browser allows file downloads
User has permissions to export reports

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule reporting module
steps.expectedResult: Schedule report UI is displayed with all filter options including department filter visible

steps.action: Select a valid date range using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date range is populated without errors

steps.action: Select a specific department from the department filter dropdown (e.g., 'Engineering Department')
steps.expectedResult: Department filter is applied and displayed as selected

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button to generate the schedule report with department filter applied
steps.expectedResult: Filtered report is generated within 10 seconds and displayed on screen showing only employees and shifts from the selected department. Report data is accurate and complete for the selected department

steps.action: Click the 'Export to PDF' button to export the filtered report
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is downloaded to the default download location with filename indicating the report type and date range (e.g., 'ScheduleReport_Engineering_[DateRange].pdf')

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully and contains data filtered by the selected department only. All employees and shifts shown belong to the selected department. No data from other departments is present. PDF includes proper formatting with headers, columns, department name clearly indicated, and all shift details are accurate and readable. Applied department filter is visible in the report header or summary section

steps.action: Verify the PDF content matches the on-screen report data
steps.expectedResult: PDF content exactly matches the filtered data displayed on screen with no discrepancies in employee names, shift times, dates, or department information

postconditions: PDF file is saved in the download folder containing department-filtered data only
Exported PDF maintains the applied department filter
PDF formatting is correct and data is readable
No data from other departments is included in the export
Export activity is logged in the system
User remains on the schedule reporting page

storyTitle: As Manager, I want schedule reports to update automatically after schedule changes to ensure data freshness

testCases.title: Validate automatic schedule report refresh after schedule changes
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
User has access to schedule reports module
Scheduling database is operational and accessible
At least one schedule report exists with current data
System change tracking mechanism is enabled
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule reports section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule reports page loads successfully and displays available reports

steps.action: Select and open a specific schedule report to view
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed with current schedule data including timestamps, employee assignments, and shift details

steps.action: Note the current data values in the report (e.g., specific employee shift assignments, dates, times)
steps.expectedResult: Current report data is clearly visible and documented for comparison

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling module while keeping the report accessible
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling module opens successfully without closing the report view

steps.action: Make a schedule change (e.g., reassign an employee to a different shift, modify shift time, or add new schedule entry)
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change is accepted by the system and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Save the schedule changes in the system
steps.expectedResult: Changes are saved successfully with a success confirmation message and timestamp

steps.action: Return to the schedule report view immediately after saving changes
steps.expectedResult: Report view is still accessible and displays the previous data state

steps.action: Monitor the report for automatic refresh, waiting up to 5 minutes and noting the exact refresh time
steps.expectedResult: Report automatically refreshes within 5 minutes showing a loading indicator or refresh notification

steps.action: Verify the report now displays the updated schedule data that was just changed
steps.expectedResult: Report accurately reflects all schedule changes made in step 5, including updated employee assignments, times, and dates

steps.action: Check the report timestamp or last updated indicator
steps.expectedResult: Report timestamp shows the current date and time, confirming the refresh occurred within the 5-minute window

postconditions: Schedule report displays the most current data
Report timestamp reflects the recent refresh time
Schedule changes are permanently saved in the database
System remains stable and responsive
No data inconsistencies exist between scheduling module and reports

testCases.title: Verify user notification of report refresh completion
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
User has access to schedule reports and scheduling modules
Notification system is enabled and configured for the user
User notification preferences are set to receive report refresh alerts
At least one schedule report is available in the system
Scheduling database is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule reports section and open a specific schedule report
steps.expectedResult: Schedule report opens and displays current schedule data

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling module to make changes
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling module loads successfully with editable schedule interface

steps.action: Trigger a schedule change by modifying an existing schedule entry (e.g., change employee shift assignment or modify shift timing)
steps.expectedResult: Schedule modification interface accepts the changes and displays them in the edit view

steps.action: Save the schedule changes to trigger the report refresh process
steps.expectedResult: System saves changes successfully and displays a confirmation message with timestamp

steps.action: Monitor the notification area (notification bell, banner, or notification center) for refresh status updates
steps.expectedResult: System displays an initial notification indicating that report refresh has been initiated

steps.action: Wait for the automatic report refresh process to complete (up to 5 minutes)
steps.expectedResult: System processes the schedule changes and refreshes the associated reports

steps.action: Check for a completion notification in the notification area
steps.expectedResult: User receives a clear notification message indicating report refresh completion with details such as report name and completion timestamp

steps.action: Click on the notification to verify it links back to the refreshed report
steps.expectedResult: Notification is clickable and navigates user directly to the updated schedule report

steps.action: Verify the refreshed report contains the schedule changes made in step 3
steps.expectedResult: Report displays accurate updated data matching the schedule changes, confirming successful refresh

steps.action: Check notification history or log to confirm the notification was recorded
steps.expectedResult: Notification appears in the user's notification history with correct timestamp and status

postconditions: User has received and acknowledged the report refresh completion notification
Schedule report contains the latest updated data
Notification is logged in the user's notification history
System is ready for subsequent schedule changes and refreshes
No pending refresh processes remain in the queue
